workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 1.2 - Fast and Easy
workout_file.description: A low key zone 2 workout with alternating intervals of comfortable and fast cadence.

textevent.message: Welcome back for a low key workout. Let's get started with a warmup.
Keep your cadence comfortable and just ease into the day.
Make sure you have your fluids, fan, and towel handy.
That's halfway through today's warmup. Let's chat about what's in store today.
Today will be a low key day consisting of zone 2 work.
We'll alternate 5min intervals of comfortable cadence and fast cadence during the main set.
Fast cadence training improves your ability to, you guessed it, spin the gear faster.
This may not sound like much, but remember Power = Force x Velocity.
So, by increasing your cadence, AKA velocity, you also increase your power.
Which is why we all train of course :-)
This is an especially useful session for those who naturally 'grind' the gear.
Just a few minutes left for the warmup, let's carry on here.
We're going to start off at a comfortable cadence of 85 RPM for our 1st interval.
All right, bring your cadence to ~85 RPM now, and let's settle into the day.
You may stand up at any time today if you need to stretch the legs a bit.
You should be able to maintain this cadence and intensity for hours.
But, don't worry today is less than 1 hour :-)
1min to go here, then we're going to 95 RPM.
Start bringing your cadence up.
All right, ~95 RPM now. This should feel slightly challenging to spin at.
But, I want you to be in control the entire time.
Pay attention to your form here.
You shouldn't be bouncing up and down, or lurching front to back in the saddle.
Your shoulders should be relaxed, elbows bent slightly, with a light grip on your bars.
Is your form still looking rock solid here? Good!
1min left, then we'll slow the cadence back to a more comfortable RPM.
Okay, back to 85 RPM now. We'll repeat that process 3 more times :-)
Even though today is easy, make sure you're taking frequent sips of fluid.
Training indoors can cause you to overheat and sweat a lot more compared to outside.
So, be sure to replace the fluids you're losing through sweat, and use a powerful fan.
Circulating air is key to keeping cool since your body dissipates heat through evaporative cooling.
1min left then we're back up to 95 RPM.
Bring the cadence up again now and settle into the rhythm once again.
Remember, focus on keeping your form at the higher RPM range.
Relax your shoulders, bend the elbows slightly, light grip on the bars.
Final minute here, keep that cadence up!
Excellent work! That's halfway through these. Back to 85 RPM here.
Remember to stand up today as needed if you need to stretch the legs.
These lower intensity days are also a great opportunity to work on your bike position.
So, feel free to practice riding in the drops.
Or, bend your elbow to 90 degrees with your hands on the hoods.
Whatever is more comfortable for you, but also gets you into a more aerodynamic position.
1 more minute to go, then we'll increase the cadence again. You're looking GREAT so far today!
95-100 RPM again now, keep the form solid!
Hopefully the fast cadence work is becoming easier by now as you find the 'groove'.
1min to go, almost done with these today :-)
Awesome work! Back to a comfortable cadence again.
Make sure you're drinking still...You should drink about 1 bottle over this workout.
In 1min, we'll finish up with our last fast cadence interval.
Lift the cadence up once more now.
If 95 RPM feels easy now, try to keep it closer to 100 RPM for this final interval.
Final minute, then we'll cooldown. Nice job today!
Nice! Now we'll steadily reduce the effort and cooldown a bit.
Since that was an easy workout, the cooldown doesn't have to be terribly long.
Just enough to spin the legs out and return the body back to baseline again.
See you next time :-)
